name: Play Flower | Interactive VR Game App
desc: Play Flower is a VR interactive piece where each 3D model represents a unique flower.
Head movement drives different layers of rotation for the 3D models in the scene, gradually unlocking the puzzle and restoring the original form.
Different angles and turns create different effects, and the projected light and shadow from the models provide a kaleidoscope-like experience.
works: Game physics and environment interaction system

name: AI Shoemaker | Motion-sensing Interactive Installation
desc: AI Shoemaker combines Unity, C++, and Azure Kinect DK.

It analyzes a user’s outfit colors to suggest the best shoe palette and shows a real-time try-on preview.
Azure Kinect DK captures the live scene, extracts the user’s skeleton, and C++ passes the data to Unity for visual display.
The visuals use heavy particle effects for a futuristic, tech-forward feel.
works: Model animator setup and state machine programming
User outfit color HSL analysis system

name: PointCloud Mesh Vertex Augmentation System | Side Project
desc: A side project derived from AI Shoemaker to solve sparse vertices when converting meshes to point clouds. I wrote a program to add vertices so the point cloud reflects the full mesh surface instead of only the skeletal vertices.

Using only native mesh vertices produces a hollow point cloud because most vertices lie on the skeleton. The algorithm fills empty areas by averaging new vertices based on triangle size and sampling texture colors at those positions to achieve a dense point cloud.
works: Particle augmentation formula derivation and implementation

ytIDs.desc:
Native-vertex version:
Using only the mesh’s original vertices produces a hollow point cloud because most vertices sit on the skeleton.

Augmented-vertex version:
The algorithm fills missing vertices based on triangle size, samples texture colors, and delivers a denser point cloud.
